pageTitle: Citroën driver Dani Sordo predicts good things for Prodrive in WRC | Autoweek
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {2850=Sordo said work on the Mini's engine had already helped move the car forward at the end of last season -- when he set more fastest times on the final 2012 round in Spain than any other driver., 4952=December 22, 2012}
textBeforeTable: 2015 World Rally Championship Shedule --> Comments See MoreWorld Rally Championship By Anthony Peacock “The chassis is really nice,” said Sordo, “but with the engine I think it's a problem with BMW that they didn't want to develop, I don't know. But I said to them team, you are Prodrive, I can't believe you can't do more than this.
